welcome_msg: Sometimes, I'm a software engineer working for Xbox. When I'm not, I like to make things. Here you'll find a (lightly pruned) archive of such things. Most of it's code, some of it's not, and all of it's useful to no one but myself! Take a look around.
site_description: Scott Munro's little corner of the internet: a lightly pruned archive of programming projects, journals, and other junk. It's a one-man flea market where nothing's for sale.

projects.title: Custom Clone Hero Chart - Time and Death and God
projects.description: A custom Clone Hero chart of the song 'Time and Death and God' by The Acacia Strain

projects.title: Dig Deep
projects.description: An isometric pico-8 game about digging and family history for the Classic Collards Game Jam.

projects.title: Avipaper.p8
projects.description: A Pico-8 demo. Fly a paper airplane through some targets.

projects.title: Scrapewood
projects.description: Assembled the Achewood web comic into an e-reader compatible EPUB

projects.title: Bman3D
projects.description: Modeled, textured, and rigged a 3D model of Bomberman from "Bomberman 64: the Second Attack!"

projects.title: Lost-n-found
projects.description: A quick puzzle game for GGJ21 that I never properly named. The theme was "lost and found". The core idea I tried to execute on was a "hot or cold" style guessing game where you reveal clues which guide you toward finding some goal.

projects.title: Wasteland Cracker
projects.description: A clone of the Fallout hacking mini-game with an included tool for solving real puzzles

projects.title: Tetrust
projects.description: A TUI Tetris clone written in rust

projects.title: WSR Image Extractor
projects.description: A tool to extract the images captured in a Windows Steps Recorder file

projects.title: The Treachery of Self-image
projects.description: A silly joke that I took too far and spent too much time on. The result? a parody of "the Treachery of Images" by Rene Magritte. In a funny turn of events, I like how it turned out.

projects.title: Tinyrenderer
projects.description: A cpu-based, didactic renderer project from Dmitry V. Sokolov's Tiny Renderer project.

projects.title: Squid Mantazord
projects.description: A top-down 2D gauntlet of sea-creatures to take the throne and become the next Squid Mantazord. Made for Global Game Jam 2017.

projects.title: Monkey Muck
projects.description: Designed, modeled, and textured an original 3D character. This character was inspired by horrific figures from franchises like Silent Hill, the Legend of Zelda, and the Thing.

projects.title: Pixitor
projects.description: A layer-based pixel art editor built using MIT"s Processing

projects.title: Ogre JRPG
projects.description: A turn-based battle system demo using Ogre3D for one of my university courses.

projects.title: Labyrinth
projects.description: A game with procedurally generated maps, and a lighting effect where only a certain radius of the map away from the character is lit (a torch effect). Built for the 2015 Fall GameJam at UT Austin.

projects.title: Menger Sponge
projects.description: An OpenGL menger sponge that can be fully rotated and have the level of recursion updated on the fly via popup menus

hidden_projects.title: NoteVis
hidden_projects.description: A tool to help visualize notes on a fretboard

hidden_projects.title: Vennfridge
hidden_projects.description: A website for looking up recipes, food items, and ingredients with sorting and filtering by various attributes. Relationships are also set up between the different recipes, food items, and ingredients so that you can more easily find related items while browsing.
hidden_projects.tools: Python, Javascript, Html, Google Cloud Platform, TravisCI

hidden_projects.title: IK2D
hidden_projects.description: A simple IK solver for a 2D, 3-point arm

hidden_projects.title: 3D Pong-like
hidden_projects.description: A 3D ball game with physics simulation, audio playback, keyboard/mouse controls, a GUI system, and both singleplayer and networked multiplayer game modes.

hidden_projects.title: Scene Graph
hidden_projects.description: A scene graph and model viewer that supports animations

hidden_projects.title: Torus Shader
hidden_projects.description: Using glsl shaders, transformed a flat sheet into a torus and replicated phong shading, texture mapping, bump mapping, and reflective surfaces.

hidden_projects.title: Quick-Radio
hidden_projects.description: A webapp generates that radio-like playlist from multiple artist seeds, and launches the playlist in the spotify webapp

hidden_projects.title: Go-Fish Probability Simulation
hidden_projects.description: A simulation of GoFish that displays the probabilities of a player"s guess being correct allowing for a player to make more educated guesses

hidden_projects.title: TUI Space Raiders
hidden_projects.description: A simple text-based form of the game Space Invaders, called Space Raiders. Implemented simple mechanics such as collisions, win-lose conditions, and a simple enemy AI.

hidden_projects.title: Binary Tree Builder
hidden_projects.description: A program that builds a binary tree from a post-order traversal and outputs the breadth-first traversal of that tree

hidden_projects.title: Neural Network Pong
hidden_projects.description: Classic game Pong, with a trained neural network opponent

hidden_projects.title: Evolving Boss Battles
hidden_projects.description: A neural network and game environment to train a simple boss-character to compete against a player character, and researched the effects of different training methods and neural network structures

hidden_projects.title: Itchnscratch
hidden_projects.description: A demo for a topdown twin stick wave shooter in Pygame. I do not remember for the life of me why I named this project Itchnscratch. I think I just needed a name and I was watching Simpsons re-runs.
